titleInfo.title: Dr. Charles Spivak at His Desk With Dictaphone

physicalDescription.extent: 1 item (photograph), 8 x 10 inches, black and white
physicalDescription.note: On back of photograph: ''Dr. Charles Spivak #1124.''

mods.abstract: Dr. Charles Spivak sits at his desk and speaks into a dictaphone. Dr. Spivak was a founder of the Jewish Consumptives' Relief Society (JCRS). The JCRS was a sanatorium for tuberculosis patients that was founded in 1904 by a group of immigrant Jewish workingmen along with the support of several leading physicians and rabbis in Denver, Colorado. The sanatorium was located on West Colfax Avenue just outside of Denver.
mods.note: Donated by AMC Cancer Research Center (JCRS).
